title: Firmware Lab Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for invention and self-challenge? Do you thrive with pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? We are looking for a creative, practical, and collaborative person with the right abilities and experience to handle day-to-day activities in wireless test labs. As a Firmware Lab Engineer, you will be the center of the embedded firmware effort!
description:
-  Assisting firmware verification engineers and multi-functional teams in lab setup and planning based on given space, power, and cooling capabilities.
-  Set up, handle, and maintain test hardware including debugging setup-related issues.
-  Working with IT to configure and debug network-related topics such as connectivity, through-put, firewalls, IP management, etc.
-  Lead and maintain a sufficient inventory of key equipment including cables, connectors, and adapters.
-  Monitor and report utilization of all test systems to ensure accurate allocation of capital resources.
key_qualifications:
3+ years of hands-on experience in wireless verification including setting up and driving wireless hardware testing in an automated environment.
Experience using shield boxes, attenuators, Buttler matrix, network analyzers, and other miscellaneous RF equipment/accessories like cables, splitters
Good understanding of wireless technologies like WIFI/BT or any other.
Experience with solving computer and network-related issues.
Ability to read and understand electrical engineering drawings, including schematics, layouts, and other technical documents.
Strong level of expertise with either Excel or Numbers.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Using basic hand tools, a multimeter, and other electronic tools.
Familiar with MacOS and iOS.
Familiar with key networking concepts and configurations.
Experience with Python scripting is a plus!
education_experience: Minimum BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science and 3+ years of equivalent technical experience.
